critique: The document aims to inspire confidence and assurance in the war effort. It seeks to quell fear and anxiety by demonstrating decisive action. It also aims to project an image of control and resolve, minimizing any sense of surprise or uncertainty. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are a sense of security and trust in the government's ability to manage the war effort effectively. The document does not aim to elicit joy, sadness, anger, or disgust.
